job_role: User Experience Research Intern, MS, Summer 2026
Experience: Internship, work, or project experience with research design utilizing various methods such as usability studies, contextual inquiry, and surveys.
Expected_CTC: Equivalent to an annualized salary range of $86,000 - $115,000 USD (approx. ₹71–95 LPA, prorated for internship duration)
Eligible: Students currently pursuing a Master's degree in Human Factors, Psychology, Human Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Information Science, or related field; penultimate year students.
location: Mountain View, CA, USA; +29 locations across the US including New York, Seattle, Austin, Atlanta, Los Angeles, and more
job_summary: Work within Google’s multi-disciplinary UX team to conduct user research and help design user-centered products. The intern will collaborate with designers, engineers, and product managers to understand user behavior, identify improvement areas, and advocate for data-driven design decisions.
role_detailes: Design and conduct independent qualitative and quantitative research studies.
Work cross-functionally with design, engineering, and product teams to inform user-centric decisions.
Collect and analyze user data using lab studies, field visits, ethnography, surveys, and A/B testing.
Communicate and advocate research findings across teams to improve product usability and effectiveness.
Integrate insights into design practices and contribute to product development strategy.
Note: Application deadline: October 31, 2025. Apply early as applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. Candidates must be physically located in the US during the internship.
mandatory: Must be enrolled in a Master’s program in a relevant field; must be in penultimate academic year and eligible to work full-time in the US for 12 weeks.
